meanings.sent1: I need some moola to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent2: She earned a lot of moola from her lemonade stand.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was full of shiny moola.
meanings.sent4: His eyes lit up when he saw the pile of moola on the table.
meanings.sent5: The sound of coins clinking together filled the room as she counted her moola.

meanings.sent1: He always carries some moola in his wallet.
meanings.sent2: The robber demanded all the moola from the register.
meanings.sent3: The birthday card had a surprise pocket with moola inside.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of security knowing she had some moola saved up.
meanings.sent5: The moola exchanged hands quickly at the bustling market.

meanings.sent1: Grandma's cookies were the best with extra moola in them.
meanings.sent2: The baker kneaded the dough to make fresh moola for the bakery.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they played with the sticky dough, pretending it was moola.
meanings.sent4: The smell of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen, reminding him of moola.
meanings.sent5: She rolled out the dough, shaping it into moola for the pie crust.
